speaker: THERAPIST
line: Keep going. Keep going. That's the way. Don't stop now. Oh, come on, keep pushing. No pain, no gain. I want five more steps and you're done. Uh-huh... four... three... good... and... super.

speaker: PIERO
line: Hit it.

speaker: THERAPIST
line: Nice and easy. You're really coming along, Bobby. I'm very pleased with your improvement.

speaker: PIERO
line: Back off. Keep your fingers on your pepper spray, just like I told you.

speaker: THERAPIST
line: Mr. Piero, is all this really necessary?

speaker: PIERO
line: Yes, ma'am. I'd say it is.

speaker: CHUCK
line: So, what's this guy's story?

speaker: PIERO
line: Cop killer. Regular people killer. General all-around waste of skin.

speaker: CHUCK
line: So what are you scared of? Guy's a freaking vegetable, I mean, what's he going to do... run over you with his big plastic wheel?

speaker: PIERO
line: I'll tell you what. You want to last here more than a week, you don't ever underestimate this man. Never trust him, never let your guard down around him. Never. Capeesh?

speaker: CHUCK
line: Comprendo.

speaker: CHUCK
line: What's up, Modell?

speaker: PIERO
line: Hey, Chuck?

speaker: PIERO
line: What the hell happened, Chuck? Where's Modell?

speaker: CHUCK
line: He had to go.

speaker: SKINNER
line: The orderly's being questioned, but judging by his mental state he's not gonna be much help to us, so there's very little we know for sure at this point. What we do know is that the last confirmed bed check was there have been no further sightings or contact.

speaker: FIRST MARSHALL
line: How did this man make his way out of the building?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Every indication is he simply walked out the front door. Due to the... unique... nature of this investigation, the FBI will head the manhunt. The Marshall Service will lend their much-welcomed expertise and will coordinate all their efforts with myself or my two designated SAC's - agents Mulder and Scully. They apprehended the subject the first time around. Agent Mulder...

speaker: MULDER
line: The subject's name is Robert Patrick Modell. He's a serial killer responsible for at least 17 murders. Specifically, he targets law enforcement. In 1996, he caused the deaths of an FBI agent and a Loudoun County sheriff's deputy. It was all a game to him. He was looking for, in his words, "a worthy adversary".

speaker: SCULLY
line: To win makes him feel important. He likes to think of himself as a ronan - a warrior without a master, adhering to the budo, the Japanese way of war. In truth, he's a highly intelligent sociopath who has no fear of dying. In keeping with his game archetype, he likes to leave clues. This is why we expect to be contacted by him, hopefully sooner rather than later.

speaker: MULDER
line: We fully expect him to pick up exactly where he left off.

speaker: SECOND MARSHALL
line: What did you mean before when you said he just walked out the building?

speaker: MULDER
line: Modell refers to himself as "pusher". Technically speaking, all of his victims' wounds were self-inflicted. This man has a unique ability to force his will upon others - to push his victims into hurting or killing themselves.

speaker: SECOND MARSHALL
line: Say what?

speaker: MULDER
line: OK, look, this is all you need to know. Do not trust this man, do not talk to him, do not engage him in conversation, even if he is unarmed. Approach him only with extraordinary caution, and then only with adequate backup.

speaker: FIRST MARSHALL
line: So what's adequate backup?

speaker: MULDER
line: Adequate backup? Every cop you can lay your hands on.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Line up for your assignment.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's Modell's condition?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Extremely weakened. The doctors here say that he can barely even walk.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh yeah?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, Mulder, I'm amazed he's even alive... the condition that we last saw him in, comatose with a bullet in the head.

speaker: MULDER
line: How did he recover?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, apparently one day about six months ago, he simply woke up. It's unusual, but it's not unheard of.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about his brain tumor that was supposed to be killing him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It still is.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is there anybody on staff here we can talk to?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He has a physical therapist. Mulder... what if Modell plans to pick up where he left off? Where does that leave you? You were his prime target. Should you even be heading this investigation?

speaker: MULDER
line: As opposed to what? What's your point?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That it's exactly what he wants. That once again you're playing his game.

speaker: TODD
line: Can I help you?

speaker: MODELL
line: Hi.

speaker: MODELL
line: You're not scared of snakes?

speaker: TODD
line: What?

speaker: MODELL
line: Looks like a timber rattler.

speaker: MODELL
line: Hold on tight to the neck, now. Don't let it bite you. Don't drop it. You drop it, it'll get you. Todd? Do you think I can get some service now?

speaker: TODD
line: Yeah.

speaker: MODELL
line: Go into the back and put the snake down.

speaker: NEWSCASTER
line: ... certainly, Paul. This was the scene here at Lorton Penitentiary less than one hour ago. Agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation along with the US Marshall Service and representatives of local law enforcement met to assemble a multi-agency task force...

speaker: THERAPIST
line: He couldn't have been faking it completely, that's all I can say. The gunshot wound did a hell of a lot of damage. You're the officer that shot him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It says here that Modell had a visitor yesterday afternoon.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's marked LSC.

speaker: THERAPIST
line: Little Sisters of Charity. They try to visit all the hospitalized inmates.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did Modell ever get any other visitors besides the Little Sisters of Charity?

speaker: THERAPIST
line: Not that I know of. He didn't have much in the way of family. He was raised in foster homes mostly.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sounds like you got to know him pretty well.

speaker: THERAPIST
line: He never gave me any grief. He worked hard at getting better. I'd talk to him sometimes.

speaker: MULDER
line: About what?

speaker: THERAPIST
line: Small talk, nothing important. He'd ask how I was.

speaker: MULDER
line: He's a very considerate man.

speaker: THERAPIST
line: I don't doubt for a second Robert Modell belongs in prison. But I never had any problem with him personally.

speaker: AGENT
line: Agents! It's Modell.

speaker: SKINNER
line: He's asking for you. We're running a trace right now. We just need thirty seconds.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: MODELL
line: Two words - it's alive.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't feel like playing your game right now, Modell.

speaker: MODELL
line: Touchy. Look, Mulder, there's something I need you to hear.

speaker: MULDER
line: Tell it to me in person, Modell.

speaker: MODELL
line: No. Seriously, listen to me.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, you listen to me. Either you come back here on your own or I drag your sorry ass back on the bumper of my car.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Time?

speaker: TRACE AGENT
line: 4 seconds.

speaker: MODELL
line: When did you turn into Clint Eastwood?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Don't let him rope you in.

speaker: MODELL
line: Now stop talking like a tough guy and pay attention. I know you're tracing this call. I don't care. I have something...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, hang up the phone.

speaker: MODELL
line: ... that I need you to hear. Mulder, are you going to...

speaker: TRACE AGENT
line: We got it. < the Sport's Hut in Occoquan >

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's nothing back there.

speaker: SKINNER
line: How far could he get?

speaker: MULDER
line: Outside!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Where is he? Where's Modell?

speaker: TODD
line: He had to go.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm going to take a wild stab here and guess this is a clue.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Appears as if he died from ingesting paint. I imagine that he did all of this and then drank what was left.

speaker: SKINNER
line: See what you can make of it. Modell?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Cerulean blue.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What the hell's the point in all of this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe his choice of victim. This is Nathan Bowman with the Loudoun County attorney's office. He's the prosecutor that tried Modell in 1996.

speaker: SKINNER
line: So you think it's simple revenge?

speaker: FEMALE AGENT
line: Sir? It's not a manifesto. It's the same single idiogram over and over.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Which is what?

speaker: FEMALE AGENT
line: Well, the hand it's in is pretty sloppy, but I think it's supposed to be "kitsunegari" - "fox hunt".

speaker: SCULLY
line: Fox Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's a little on the nose, don't you think?

speaker: MULDER
line: Was Nathan Bowman married?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yep.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What are you thinking?

speaker: MULDER
line: Linda. Bet that's his wife, huh?

speaker: RECEPTIONIST
line: NovaMax Realty.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hi, Linda?

speaker: RECEPTIONIST
line: I'm sorry. Mrs. Bowman has left the office to meet a client. May I take a message?

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you know the name of the client that Mrs. Bowman went to see?

speaker: RECEPTIONIST
line: It's, uh, Mr. Fox Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's him.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Location. Find out where he's at.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you know where Mrs. Bowman went to meet Fox Mulder, a location?

speaker: RECEPTIONIST
line: I know it's a commercial property in Falls Church, uh, can you hold on please?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Give me the Falls Church PD.

speaker: SECOND OFFICER
line: Unit 6 at 214 Channel Avenue. Signs of forced entry. We're gonna check it out.

speaker: DISPATCHER
line: Exercise extreme caution, 6. Backup is in route.

speaker: MODELL
line: Hello. Officer? I'm over here. That's right. No, not that way. Not that way either, but you're getting warmer. Dead ahead. Straight in front. Buddy, I'm straight in front of you. What do you want me to do, draw you a map? Keep coming. Almost there.

speaker: FIRST OFFICER
line: Put it down! Put the gun down! Put it down! Now! On the floor! Face down! Do it! Marty, I got him! Get up here!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Federal Agent! Officer, where are you?

speaker: FIRST OFFICER
line: Upstairs! Sir, I got him!

speaker: FIRST OFFICER
line: I got him.

speaker: SECOND OFFICER
line: He's gone crazy! Get him the hell away from me!

speaker: AGENT
line: Give me your gun. Just give me your gun.

speaker: SKINNER
line: He was here. He did come for the woman.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why Bowman's wife? What would he want with her?

speaker: UNIDENTIFIED OFFICER
line: Hey, we got a visitor.

speaker: MULDER
line: Linda Bowman? Fox Mulder.

speaker: LINDA BOWMAN
line: Hi. Uh, you're my 12:15?

speaker: LINDA BOWMAN
line: The appointment was made this morning, through my secretary. All I know was I was supposed to meet a Mr. Mulder here. He didn't leave a number, and I couldn't call him to tell him that I was running late. Why would someone do this to Nathan?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mrs. Bowman? Did your husband ever discuss his work as a prosecutor with you?

speaker: LINDA BOWMAN
line: Sometimes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did he ever mention the name Robert Patrick Modell?

speaker: LINDA BOWMAN
line: Pusher? That was Nathan's biggest case. Why?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Can you think of any reason why this man, Modell, would take an interest in you.

speaker: LINDA BOWMAN
line: What do you mean?

speaker: SKINNER
line: We believe he murdered your husband. It also appears that he's the man that made the appointment to see you today.

speaker: LINDA BOWMAN
line: No. No, no, he's in prison.

speaker: MULDER
line: Not since 6:00 this morning.

speaker: LINDA BOWMAN
line: Oh God.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You're safe with us, Mrs. Bowman. If you'll come with me, we'll place you in protective custody.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Find him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, sir.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Why didn't Modell just kill those two cops? What was to stop him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, hopefully, he wasn't capable.

speaker: MULDER
line: As in too tired?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, we've seen that before.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe. I don't know. Something's just not making sense. Can I borrow your radio?

speaker: MARSHALL
line: Yes, sir.

speaker: MODELL
line: Gracias, amigo.

speaker: MODELL
line: What took you so long?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, I got him. Come quick.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where are you, Mulder?

speaker: MODELL
line: Hold on.

speaker: MULDER
line: North side of Channel, second floor. Some kind of company, some engineering company.

speaker: MODELL
line: Hold on, hold on, we need to talk.

speaker: MULDER
line: Shut up, Modell.

speaker: MODELL
line: Mulder, listen.

speaker: MULDER
line: I said shut up.

speaker: MODELL
line: There's something I need you to...

speaker: MULDER
line: Shut up or I will shoot you, you son of a bitch.

speaker: MODELL
line: Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: I will shoot you, shut up.

speaker: MODELL
line: You're going to listen to me. You're going to listen to me, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: I will shoot you.

speaker: MODELL
line: Listen. Mulder...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what happened? Where's Modell?

speaker: MULDER
line: He had to go.

speaker: SCULLY
line: About 10 minutes ago. He can't have gotten far. Anything?

speaker: MARSHALL
line: No sign.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, Agent Mulder's fine. Yes, sir.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How are you feeling?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, aside from the utter grinding humiliation that comes from knowing I let our suspect go, pretty good.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It could have happened to anyone, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, actually it couldn't have. I didn't find Modell. He sought me out. He wanted me to hear his message.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Which was what?

speaker: MULDER
line: "Don't play the game."

speaker: SCULLY
line: Whose game? His?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't think so. I'm not even sure he's playing a game.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you talking about? Of course he is. You said yourself that he was gonna pick up where he left off.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then why didn't he kill the cops? Or the prison guards? Or, hell, while we're at it, why didn't he kill me? Why didn't he make me eat a bullet out of my own gun? He could have.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He killed Nathan Bowman.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, he was definitely there, but that doesn't prove that he did it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, this man's affected you. He's influenced your thinking.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's not like that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A man is made to drink a gallon of cerulean blue paint. Kitsunegari - fox hunt. You're saying now that's not Modell?

speaker: MULDER
line: Modell is involved. He's related to it somehow, but not the way you think.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's your opinion?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, that's my opinion.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How can you be sure it's your own?

speaker: MULDER
line: What do we still agree on here? That Modell was pursuing Linda Bowman? I'd like to know why.

speaker: LINDA BOWMAN
line: I'm sorry, I don't know if I can tell you much more than I already have.

speaker: MULDER
line: We appreciate your help.

speaker: LINDA BOWMAN
line: I know Nathan was very proud of having prosecuted the case. He said this man, Modell, was extremely clever and dangerous, and that he was a menace to society, and Nathan mentioned that an FBI agent had ultimately shot him. Was that you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes.

speaker: LINDA BOWMAN
line: He said you crippled him and put him in a wheelchair. Nathan said it was too bad that you just didn't kill him. That would have saved the taxpayers the cost of a trial.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Your husband talked with you a lot about it.

speaker: LINDA BOWMAN
line: Well, as I said, he was proud. I guess he felt that, that it was his brush with greatness.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is it possible that he could have mentioned you to Robert Modell?

speaker: LINDA BOWMAN
line: No, no, I sincerely doubt it. You see, Nathan and I, we were only married two months.

speaker: MULDER
line: How long did you know him?

speaker: LINDA BOWMAN
line: Well...... it was two months and two days. Well, why wait when it's true love? You never know how long you have.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, you don't.

speaker: LINDA BOWMAN
line: It's not like Nathan was implusive or flighty. I don't want to paint him as that.

speaker: MULDER
line: He was true blue. Thank you.

speaker: MULDER
line: She killed Nathan Bowman.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: Modell was there but for some other reason. She killed her husband.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Mulder, what...

speaker: MULDER
line: Wait a minute, just hear me out. Her husband's brush with greatness, she doesn't want to paint him as being impulsive. Who the hell talks like that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You tell me.

speaker: MULDER
line: She was waving it under our nose, she was playing with us. Modell told me, he warned me not to play the game. I think it was her game he was talking about.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Modell told you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Has she asked how her husband was murdered? Has she shown any interest in the details? An escaped serial killer is supposedly stalking her. Does she seem particularly fearful to you?

speaker: SKINNER
line: The woman's in shock, Agent Mulder. She's not herself. And I might add, neither are you.

speaker: MULDER
line: You heard it in there, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, no. I'm sorry. You said it yourself, you said "don't listen to Modell, don't trust him". But you've done both.

speaker: MULDER
line: But what if she can do what Modell does?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I think you should go home.

speaker: MULDER
line: You think I should go home?

speaker: SKINNER
line: You're suspended until such time I'm confident your judgement is sound. Give me your weapon.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who are you afraid I'm gonna point it at?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I think you should do what he says.

speaker: LINDA BOWMAN
line: Excuse me. Would it be possible for me to get something to drink? Water?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Uh, yes ma'am, I'll have somebody come right in.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll prove it.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Go fetch her some water!

speaker: THERAPIST
line: I really don't know the man that well. I'm sorry you got the impression that I do.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, just anything at all that you might recall. Did he ever talk about his past? You know, mention anybody special, a woman, something like that.

speaker: THERAPIST
line: No.

speaker: MULDER
line: Anything remarkable he ever said that you can remember.

speaker: THERAPIST
line: I guess one time someone else said something about him that struck me as unusual.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah? What was that?

speaker: THERAPIST
line: It was one of the nuns who visits from Little Sisters of Charity. She, uh, she once referred to him as a "conquered warrior". I thought that was kind of weird.

speaker: MULDER
line: Was this the same nun that visited him the day before he escaped?

speaker: THERAPIST
line: Yeah, the same one that always visits.

speaker: MULDER
line: How many times did she visit him?

speaker: THERAPIST
line: Maybe three, four.

speaker: MULDER
line: Would you take a look at something for me? Is that the woman, is that the nun?

speaker: THERAPIST
line: Hang on, I'm blind as a bat.

speaker: THERAPIST
line: Therapy room.

speaker: MULDER
line: Here... glasses.

speaker: THERAPIST
line: Uh, uh-huh, yeah. Yeah, absolutely. It's empty.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where did you leave them?

speaker: THERAPIST
line: Uh, uh-huh. Uh-huh, OK.

speaker: THERAPIST
line: Oh yeah, he's here.

speaker: MULDER
line: No!

speaker: MULDER
line: I need help in here!

speaker: MULDER
line: Help!

speaker: MARSHALL
line: You got him?

speaker: MODELL
line: Go home.

speaker: MARSHALL
line: What?

speaker: MODELL
line: Go home.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Scully, it's me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where are you?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm at the prison.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you were told to lay off.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's a little late for that now. Modell's therapist just electrocuted herself right in front of me, and she was on the phone when she did it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It was Modell.

speaker: MULDER
line: It was Linda Bowman.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder...

speaker: MULDER
line: The therapist would have identified her and verified that she visited Modell in the prison.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Would have? You don't know that.

speaker: MULDER
line: Listen, Scully, just trace the call and cut off any access that woman has to a phone. I'm heading back there right now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I'm not at the safe house.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're not?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We're at the Chain Bridge Mall, investigating a suicide.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why isn't anybody picking up at the safe house switchboard?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Back in the trucks...

speaker: SKINNER
line: On the floor, Modell!

speaker: MODELL
line: Hey, it's Mel Cooley.

speaker: SKINNER
line: On your face, do it now!

speaker: SKINNER
line: I said now!

speaker: MODELL
line: I have a gun.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did he try to speak to you?

speaker: SKINNER
line: He said we got our man.

speaker: MULDER
line: What happened?

speaker: SKINNER
line: You were told to go home, Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: What happened?

speaker: SKINNER
line: He had a gun. I saw it clearly, it was a revolver.

speaker: MULDER
line: He pointed a gun at you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We haven't found the gun yet.

speaker: MULDER
line: He said to you that he had a gun.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yes, and he did. Excuse me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Modell was unarmed. He purposely drew Skinner's fire.

speaker: SCULLY
line: For what possible reason?

speaker: MULDER
line: To protect someone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Linda Bowman?

speaker: MULDER
line: To take the fall for her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's one hell of a plan, Mulder. A serial killer makes us believe that he's guilty, in turn diverting the suspicion away from the real estate lady. Well, he had me going.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where is she?

speaker: SCULLY
line: They've taken her home. There is no reason to keep her in protective custody, Mulder. It is over.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, it's not.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where are you going?

speaker: MULDER
line: If Modell makes it through surgery, I want to be the first person that he talks to.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, talking to him has already done you enough harm.

speaker: MULDER
line: OK, look, you do me a favor, Scully. You give me a call when you think I've come to my senses, all right?

speaker: "NURSE"
line: Sir? I'm going to need to change the patient's bandages.

speaker: MULDER
line: Call me if he wakes up, please.

speaker: LINDA BOWMAN
line: Yes, sir.

speaker: LINDA BOWMAN
line: Bobby? Why did you do it? I didn't ask you to come after me.

speaker: MODELL
line: Don't... don't make a mistake.

speaker: LINDA BOWMAN
line: I'm not. After what they've done, do you think I'd let them get away with this? I'm gonna finish what you started.

speaker: MODELL
line: No. Stop now. Stop...

speaker: LINDA BOWMAN
line: Bobby... Bobby, you're not in any pain. You feel wonderful. You've never felt better. Your heart is slowing. It's tired. It's too worn out to keep beating. Let it rest.

speaker: LINDA BOWMAN
line: It slows... it slows... it stops.

speaker: NURSE
line: I've got the lidocaine, doctor.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Never mind. Put him down as 7:38.

speaker: NURSE
line: Yes, doctor.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: I'm sorry.

speaker: "SCULLY"
line: Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, what are you doing here?

speaker: "SCULLY"
line: You were right about her, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully.

speaker: "SCULLY"
line: She's making me do this.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where is she?

speaker: "SCULLY"
line: She's here. Mulder, make her stop. I can't help myself.

speaker: MULDER
line: Linda Bowman!

speaker: "SCULLY"
line: Mulder make her stop.

speaker: MULDER
line: Show yourself!

speaker: "SCULLY"
line: Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: No! No!

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm gonna kill you!

speaker: "LINDA BOWMAN"
line: Don't listen to her, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: "LINDA BOWMAN"
line: It's me. You were right about her. Linda Bowman is pushing you.

speaker: MULDER
line: What the hell are you talking about?

speaker: "LINDA BOWMAN"
line: I'm Scully. Linda's right behind you, she's telling you I'm her.

speaker: MULDER
line: You killed her!

speaker: "LINDA BOWMAN"
line: Mulder, I'm Scully. I'm not dead. She wants you to shoot me. She knows you'll never forgive yourself.

speaker: MULDER
line: Shut up!

speaker: "LINDA BOWMAN"
line: Listen to me!

speaker: MULDER
line: Shut up!

speaker: "LINDA BOWMAN"
line: Your mother is Tina, your sister is Samantha!

speaker: MULDER
line: Shut up!

speaker: "LINDA BOWMAN"
line: Modell warned you. Don't play her game.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder...

speaker: LINDA BOWMAN
line: You think you can hold me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, we'd like an ambulance to 214 Channel Avenue.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Linda Bowman.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She has an advanced temporal lobe tumor, just like Modell's. It seems to run in the family.

speaker: SKINNER
line: She and Modell are related?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Fraternal twins.

speaker: SKINNER
line: He meant to protect his sister.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Apparently, she only found out about his existence six months ago. They were separated when they were two weeks ago, raised apart. Her "fox hunt"... I'm guessing that she wanted revenge for what she feels we did to her brother.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Anything you want to add to that?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think that covers it.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Mulder, a moment, please.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I just want to say you did a good job.

speaker: MULDER
line: How's that?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Nobody could have figured this out but you. You knew it was Linda Bowman and not Modell. You were way ahead of me.

speaker: MULDER
line: I almost killed my partner.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Mulder, despite that, you prevailed. You won her game.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then how come I feel like I lost?
